item.title: Roblox: Drift Carts Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Drift Carts Codes
  • How to Redeem Drift Carts Codes
  • How to Get More Drift Carts Codes

Drift Carts is a racing simulator, but quite unusual, since your vehicle is carts. Players have to drift them around a large supermarket and also participate in races to earn money. Fortunately, there is a way to earn extra Cash faster, namely, using Drift Carts codes.

Codes will reward you with various goodies in this Roblox experience. Just a few of them will be enough to purchase a new cart from the very beginning of the game. But hurry, as they are active for a limited time.

Updated April 6, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: New codes have just been added to Drift Carts, offering a variety of rewards. These include cash boosts, extra time for 2x money, and a cool new Purple Cart. Be sure to grab these rewards while they’re available. Keep checking back for more updates, as new codes may bring even more valuable bonuses.

All Drift Carts Codes

Working Drift Carts Codes

  • 5k_L!KES - Redeem this code to get 5,000 Cash (NEW)
  • 1MILLION!!! - Redeem this code to get 5 minutes of 2x Money (NEW)
  • 20k_MEMBERS - Redeem this code to get 2,000 Cash (NEW)
  • COMMUNITY_C4RT! - Redeem this code to get a Purple Cart

Expired Drift Carts Codes

  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get 5,000 Cash

At first glance, Drift Carts may seem like a simple gameplay. But in reality, you will have to spend quite a lot of time training to get used to drifting during cart races. It is important to note that the more expensive vehicles you use, the more you will earn and the easier it is to win races. However, your starting cart is bad. And to get rid of it as quickly as possible, you should redeem Drift Carts codes.

As always, codes contain various rewards. Some of them grant you money, while others can offer rare carts. In any case, they all significantly boost your progress. However, after a while, each code expires, so you do not want to delay using them.

How to Redeem Drift Carts Codes

Luckily, the code redemption option in Drift Carts works as simply as in most other Roblox racing simulators. In other words, the feature is available from the first minutes of the game to all players and requires only a few clicks from them. For convenience, you can follow these steps:

  • First, launch the Drift Carts experience.
  • Then, click on the Codes button in the lower left corner of the screen.
  • After that, enter the code in the corresponding box and click on the Confirm button to claim the reward.

How to Get More Drift Carts Codes

Due to the short validity period, you will want to use Drift Carts codes as soon as they are released. And for this, we recommend that you start following the official pages of the developers. There you will find all the latest news, including events, updates, giveaways, and Roblox codes:

  • Drift Carts Roblox group
  • Drift Carts Discord server

item.title: Roblox: My Hello Kitty Cafe Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • My Hello Kitty Cafe Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in My Hello Kitty Cafe
  • My Hello Kitty Cafe Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like My Hello Kitty Cafe
  • About the My Hello Kitty Cafe Developers

In My Hello Kitty Cafe , Roblox players will create their own cafe and start their business. To increase the chances of success, this article offers a list of My Hello Kitty Cafe codes that grant precious in-game rewards. These codes won't be around forever though, so Roblox players should hurry up and redeem them before they expire.

Updated April 6, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: A new code is available for My Hello Kitty Cafe , offering a fresh reward for you to claim. You can get a Gacha Tix, along with other rewards like Gems and a cute Pompompurin Mascot. These bonuses can enhance your gameplay and help you progress faster. Be sure to redeem the code soon and check back later for even more updates.

My Hello Kitty Cafe Codes

Roblox: Combat Warriors Kill Sound IDs List

How to Redeem Codes in My Hello Kitty Cafe

Players who want to claim free rewards in My Hello Kitty Cafe can follow the straightforward steps below:

  • Open Roblox and launch My Hello Kitty Cafe
  • Once in the game, go to the upper side of the screen and press the Settings button here.
  • On the left side of the pop-up menu, press the Code button.
  • Then, insert the code into the text box.
  • Press the button Confirm, and rewards will be stored automatically.

Just like in many other Roblox games, each code is time-limited and can only be redeemed once per account. With that in mind, players should check this article often to get the latest codes and claim free rewards faster than others. While redeeming a code, it's important to check the spelling and make sure that everything is accurate in order to claim the rewards.

My Hello Kitty Cafe Tips and Tricks

Below are some tips and tricks for Hello Kitty Cafe :

  • To level up quickly, players can obtain more workers using vending machines.
  • City areas offer equipment like microwaves and coffee machines.
  • Placing furniture and equipment can be done through interior and equipment options.
  • Acquiring items with popularity bonuses from the shop also helps level up faster.

The Best Roblox Town and City Games Like My Hello Kitty Cafe

Below, players will find five games like My Hello Kitty Cafe . These games are also in the town and city genre and offer a great gaming experience. So, hurry up and try them:

  • Da Hood
  • Jailbreak
  • Ohio
  • Brookhaven
  • Berry Avenue

About the My Hello Kitty Cafe Developers

Rock Panda Games is a group of developers who released My Hello Kitty Cafe , which immediately became popular. But they have another game that fans can try called My Supermarket .

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2's Social Features Could Be a Godsend for One Underserved Genre
item.description:
As arguably the biggest and most important showcase of 2025, the latest announcements for the Nintendo Switch 2 revealed some key features that could help revive a longstanding, albeit underserved, genre within Nintendo games. While it had been anticipated that Nintendo would reveal more about the Nintendo Switch 2 throughout 2025, its recent Nintendo Direct in early April likely surpassed most expectations with a slew of announcements for new exclusive and partner games like Mario Kart World , Donkey Kong Bananza , and The Duskbloods . However, alongside these announcements were new features and peripherals for the Switch 2 that could hide some untapped potential.

In contrast to other companies and their next-gen consoles, Nintendo has maintained a focus on unique selling points like portability, socialization, and creativity, with examples like its Joy-Cons' versatility or the 3D effects on the 3DS. Combined with an ethos centered around family-friendly content and positive lifestyles, this has led to a tradition among Nintendo's consoles with games or "exergames" geared towards health and fitness, such as Wii Sports , Wii Fit , and Nintendo Switch Sports . Now that players know more about Nintendo's next console and its features, the Switch 2 could make or break this tradition with its own range of social exergames.

Nintendo Switch 2 Embraces Social Gaming With Its New Camera and Game Chat

Just as social gaming had been a core principle behind the original Switch, it appears that Nintendo has revisited the drawing board in that respect when designing the Switch 2. In addition to its more ergonomic, versatile, and potentially durable Joy-Cons 2, Nintendo revealed several new features and peripherals that appear to push the social gaming envelope even further. For example, during the latest Nintendo Direct showcasing the new Camera and Discord-like GameChat, Nintendo even outlined how these features could enhance existing games, such as Camera-exclusive minigames for the Switch 2 Edition of Super Mario Party Jamboree .

Nintendo Switch 2's New Social Features May Already Face An Uphill Struggle

However, to what extent Nintendo plans to integrate these social features into existing Switch or new Switch 2 games will remain to be seen, especially when criticism regarding the Switch 2's prices has already been raised. Similar to what happened to Nintendo Labo, it is possible that these GameChat and Camera features might not prove to be sustainable despite Nintendo's ambitions with the Switch 2. So long as Nintendo continues to expand and refine these features, such as resolving potential lag and justifying the price of its Camera peripheral, then this potential might not go to waste.

Nintendo Switch 2 Needs Switch Sports And Ring Fit Adventure Sequels

Both among the Switch's best-selling games, Switch Sports and Ring Fit Adventure helped maintain Nintendo's console tradition of sports and exergames, with the latter experiencing a surge in sales and popularity in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic and stay-at-home lockdowns. While Nintendo's flagship franchises like Super Mario , Donkey Kong , and Metroid will draw in players for the Switch 2, it shouldn't ignore the appeal and benefits these exergame series could have for the upcoming console. Especially if these games capitalize on the Switch 2's new social features and peripherals, sequels to Switch Sports or Ring Fit Adventure could help sell the console to a broader demographic.

Nintendo Switch 2's Social Features Are Perfect For Its Next-Gen Exergames

Possibly one of the biggest challenges to overcome regarding health and fitness is the motivation to maintain any diet, exercise, or other lifestyle changes that people make. While the likes of Wii Sports and Wii Fit tried to tackle this through gaming alone, these games arguably fell short of the social aspect of exercise, such as the encouragement to keep going or recognition for meeting goals. By embracing the Switch 2's accessories and console features like its Camera and GameChat, prospective next-gen exergames like Ring Fit Adventure 2 could incorporate socialization into their gameplay with group exercises, motivation from other players, and more.

item.title: Best Ubisoft DLCs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Ubisoft excels in creating immersive game worlds with incredible detail in both base games and DLC expansions.
  • DLC expansions offer innovative gameplay changes, new perspectives, and beneficial enhancements to player experiences.
  • DLC expansions like Warlords of New York, Crimson Moon, and Curse of the Pharaohs add depth, challenge, and new content to popular games.

What makes Ubisoft stand out as a game developer is how they create their worlds. Whether it’s a fictional world or based on a real location, they include phenomenal details to make the environments come to life, like in Assassin’s Creed or Far Cry . What’s better is how much players can interact with the worlds through their abundance of content.

Such design isn’t exclusive to their base games, but also their DLC expansions, which sometimes feel like standalone titles with their content. Not every DLC expansion needs to be huge, but many of them do provide enough to innovate their game’s formula. The most ideal design of a DLC expansion includes beneficial changes to improve the player’s experience through a new perspective or gameplay element.

10 Warlords Of New York (Tom Clancy's The Division 2)

Criminal Rulers

In this DLC, the titular Warlords of New York are the major obstacles dominating their reign over the lower parts of Manhattan with their overpowered weapons. To stop their dominance from spreading, the player must search to eliminate the five rogue targets. The player can challenge the mastermind behind everything once he’s taken over each region under enemy hands.

Which region is challenged for control rests entirely on the player. The player takes down the four threatening leaders, all of whom use different tactics to spice up combat. Defeating them will improve the player’s utility, letting them use the defeated warlord’s skills to their own advantage in the coming fights.

9 Crimson Moon (Starlink: Battle For Atlas)

For The Games

Players who love the wide exploration of Starlink: Battle For Atlas can enjoy a better experience by participating in the Crimson Moon expansion. The titular event is known to start the Outlaw Games, which involves completing several missions within Fortune’s Rest.

The missions involve competing in racing and combat against different factions, like Outlaws and Prospectors. Only the victorious will earn the games’ rewarding trophies and the chance to gain exclusive loot. The best addition that the DLC offers is the exclusive Star Fox mission with the trained iconic pilots for the Nintendo Switch.

8 Curse of the Pharaohs (Assassin's Creed Origins)

First Touch Of Supernatural

Curse of the Pharaohs takes place in the City of Thebes where Bayek travels to search for the main malevolent cause of the titular curse. Hearing gossip about potential tomb thievery forces the hidden one to investigate the ancient mystical ruins.

This journey is a lot more supernatural compared to the main campaign, since it involves dealing with inhuman beasts like undead pharaohs and scorpions. Despite such maliciousness, Bayek will use the abilities of a hidden one to overcome any obstacle to cure the dark magic hindering Thebes.

7 Myths Of The Eastern Realm (Immortals Fenyx Rising)

Two Sides Of The Same Coin

Myths Of The Eastern Realm is an alternate scenario for Immortal Fenyx Rising . Ku is the new protagonist who takes the main hero role to stop a mysterious force from harming his world. He must find a cure to restore cursed humanity.

The expansion’s best offering is its new Chinese-inspired setting. Ku will encounter powerful beings who will assist or hinder him on his quest, like Nuwa and Gong Gon. It plays very similarly to the base game, so veteran players can focus more on its immersive realm. Along with its familiar gameplay, players enjoy its wide freedom, encouraging players to tackle new enemies and puzzles in any way desired.

6 Donkey Kong Adventure (Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle)

Going Bananas For Adventure

Donkey Kong Adventure allows Donkey Kong to return to action, though in a different game genre. When Rabbid Kong takes away his bananas, Donkey Kong explores the island to stop their tropical reign, which involves facing his cosplay self and army in battle.

This new adventure has some challenges like the platformer's original games, testing the new team's synergy against some new enemies and bosses empowered by the bananas. Similar to the base game, it's important to utilize the environment like traps and abysses for an extra advantage. With Donkey Kong's strength and movement, he becomes a great support when alongside his current allies.

5 Bad Blood (Watch Dogs)

Clearing Up Hacking Business

Aiden Pierce was supposed to relieve his hacking business, though his enemies still pursue him in Bad Blood . This extra campaign lets T-Bone face the remaining annoyances still chasing them down within Chicago.

T-Bone explores the Chicago streets to handle the new missions for erasing their tracks while quelling adversaries’ activities like Street Sweep contracts. Along with the new missions, players also get access to new weapons, RC car abilities, and outfits to accomplish the quests in a fashionable style.

4 Jack the Ripper (Assassin's Creed Syndicate)

Killer Interpretation

Jack the Ripper makes the Frye twins return to action in a noir-style chase involving an infamous legend. They travel around the Whitechapel district of London for any clues about the killer, which includes investigating murder scenes for evidence or handling potential suspects.

The greatest experience is playing the serial killer with his brutal techniques. His distorted mentality and fighting style bring a new perspective of London that’s more unsettling than the base game. The game revolves around the new fear system, which lets an assassin use brutal takedowns on a target to scare the nearby crowd.

3 Mask Of Madness (Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown)

Palace Of Insanity

Mask Of Madness is a special quest for Sargon that pits him against a former ally. Once Sargon falls into her conniving clutches, he’s forced to find the escape route of the Immortal’s mind palace. Such maliciousness was designed with just one main purpose: to kill the “traitor.”

The distorted location is much more dangerous compared to the base game due to its traps, enemies, ancient tricks, puzzles, and complicated platforming. This extra journey is only for those who yearn for a better challenge while learning some backstory behind the most ominous Immortal.

2 Rayman In The Phantom Show (Mario + Rabbids Sparks Of Hope)

Gaining The Ratings

Rayman In The Phantom Show is another campaign for Rayman to return to the spotlight. The iconic platformer gets invited to a familiar villain's dramatic plays, though this requires him to team up with the cosplaying Rabbids, despite their conflicts and tensions in the past.

Each level requires Rayman’s team to strategize around the scene’s layout to earn better mission ratings. Rabbid Peach and Rabbid Mario play very similarly to the base game, though Rayman has a unique toolkit with his transformation costumes to turn the tides of battle.

1 Bring The Crunch (South Park: The Fractured But Whole)

Heroes In Horror

Bring The Crunch is a special quest given to the New Kid that involves certain counselors being taken. They’re brought to the camp in Lake Tardicaca to investigate the issue, but the journey is more intense than expected, making their tasks more difficult while keeping the faithful vibes of the South Park IP.

The New Kid will face many adversaries with vibes as ominous as movie killers like Jason, including some familiar bosses like Spontaneous Bootay. The New Kid can easily overcome its challenges by using tactical teamwork, including working with the new hero, Mintberry Crunch.

item.title: The Nintendo Switch 2 Has Left One Bizarre But Important Question Hanging
item.description:
Despite how small a detail it might seem and how weird it might be for Nintendo to bring it up during its showcase of the Nintendo Switch 2 , an important question still remains about an infamous but crucial safety feature. Much like the original Nintendo Switch, Nintendo is again demonstrating its focus on making the Nintendo Switch 2 and its games just as family-friendly, such as providing updated and enhanced parental controls for the upcoming console. However, Nintendo has yet to confirm if one of its more bizarre, albeit justifiable, safety features will return for the Switch 2 and its game cartridges.

While Nintendo hadn't initially advertised the taste of its cartridges when launching the original Switch, it was ultimately forced to come clean and admit that it had used a "bittering" or aversive agent to prevent individuals from accidentally swallowing its Switch games. But while it was unlikely that games such as Cooking Mama would be taken literally and eaten, this feature did make some sense from a health and safety standpoint, even though Nintendo's previous cartridges for its DS consoles hadn't included this agent. Therefore, with the Switch 2 successor on the horizon, Nintendo should confirm upfront if its cartridges will taste just as bad.

Explaining The Importance Behind The Taste of Nintendo Switch Cartridges

It was arguably just as weird as the feature itself that the Switch cartridge's bad taste was discovered by chance after games journalist Jeff Gerstmann randomly taste-tested one during a live stream, later recounting the experience via social media.

Likely to Nintendo's chagrin, as tasting Switch games went viral, it was prompted to release a statement via Polygon confirming that its cartridges had a non-toxic coating of denatonium benzoate, a common aversive agent used in paint, antifreeze, and other solvents to deter accidental ingestion. But while the novelty of this unique safety measure has died down, the fact that the Switch's cartridges taste foul has persisted.

Regardless of how weird this design choice seemed, there appeared to be some logic behind Nintendo's decision when considering the bigger picture, as the company was marketing the Switch as the family-friendly console of choice. Though older players would likely recognize both the absurdity and potential danger of swallowing a game cartridge, ensuring that kids are discouraged from doing so with this unusual safety feature fits this family-friendly model. So long as Nintendo maintains this strategy with the Switch 2 as its successor, it stands to reason that it will share this feature.

The Case For And Against The Switch 2 Continuing This Safety Feature

While Nintendo hasn't shied away from more mature games, such as recently partnering with FromSoftware for the Switch 2 exclusive The Duskbloods , it hasn't lost its core focus on "family fun" gaming. With the Switch 2's improved Joy-Con 2 design, Game Chat and Camera peripherals, and launch titles such as Mario Kart World , Split Fiction , and Hogwarts Legacy , Nintendo appears to be adhering to the original Switch's family-friendly approach through social gaming for all ages. As a result, it may as well continue to use an aversive agent on its Switch 2 cartridges as there's no such thing as being too safe.

However, one controversial change with the Switch 2 is Nintendo's new "game-key cards," seemingly encouraging players to buy cheaper digital game copies and use GameShare to share these with other players. It seems that Nintendo is joining the push towards a digital-only model seen elsewhere within the gaming industry and could be aiming to out physical games entirely. If this is the case, then the arguably niche safety feature of bad-tasting Switch 2 cartridges may be redundant if they're only going to be replaced by the likes of GameShare and game-keys.

Source: Polygon
